sec.p: Sub-units 2c and 2d continue to the top of this zone. The base of the zone is marked by a sudden rise in the frequency of Quercus and a small increase in Corylus pollen. These trends continue to the middle of the zone, where Quercus achieves peak frequencies (53%). Pinus and Betula pollen frequencies decline simultaneously. The frequencies of most taxa stabilise in the upper half of the zone, with Quercus and Pinus dominant. Alnus and Corylus pollen undergo slight frequency increases. A single Typha fruit (at 12.20 m) and a bryophyte fragment (at −10.0 m) were the only macrofossils recorded.
